Predefined Rules¶

Predefined rules are CSS classes defined by blue leaf.

Normally, blue leaf does not create any CSS rules for specific classes. If a module defines such rules it should happen via the predefine mixin in order to allow site developers to disable these rules.

Predefined rules can be turned off via the $predefined variable in blue leaf Core.

Note: These mixins are not for use from outside the framework. They are documented for framework developers.

SASS¶

@mixin predefine($classname,$flags...) { @content }

Predefines a CSS rule for the given $classname.

$classname

The CSS class name.

$flags...

Some flags to specify how the rules have to be defined. Currently, this has no function.

@content

CSS rules.
